intro: Zaluzianskia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf eveningprimrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Zaluzianskia angustifolia is often found in prairie and wetland ecosystems, contributing to the biodiversity of these habitats.
